ygData.subject: Re: Getting our Concerns Noticed
ygData.msgSnippet: ... LISTEN TO ME.  This won t help your cause any.  Sign a petition, do something, but actively attempting to annoy/ raise attention from the GMs rarely
ygData.messageBody:
>2. Have 1 day where everyone gets on and /feedbacks them either the
>same statement or a statement containing identical issues.

LISTEN TO ME. This won't help your cause any. Sign a petition, do
something, but actively attempting to annoy/"raise attention" from the GMs
rarely works, if anything it raises animosity.

I've suffered through this myself, where someone sets up a Web site to get
some issue addressed with our games. There's a form letter, a space to
fill in your e-mail, and then a "click here to send this e-mail" button.

What happens is we get flooded with e-mail for about three days. But after
the first half dozen or so, the others are deleted because they're easy to
identify.

So we do a mass /feedback, and the ones after the first half dozen will be
discarded, unread. Hell, anything to do with SKs likely will be discarded
unread on the assumption it's something to do with the mass feedback.

Brian
